meanings.definition: The point within the earth where an earthquake originates.
meanings.sent1: During the earthquake, the hypocentre released powerful energy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the hypocentre to understand seismic activity.
meanings.sent3: The hypocentre decided to take a break from causing earthquakes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter erupted from within her like a hypocentre of joy.
meanings.sent5: The hypocentre's location deep underground made it hard to reach.

meanings.sent1: The firefighters rushed to the hypocentre of the blast to help.
meanings.sent2: The bomb squad investigated the hypocentre of the explosion.
meanings.sent3: The hypocentre of the fireworks display lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The hypocentre of the argument was a misunderstanding between friends.
meanings.sent5: The hypocentre of the volcano eruption spewed lava and ash.
